domains.description: Comprehensive tools for managing user accounts and authentication, including user lifecycle operations, credential validation, and identity verification

tools.name: verify_identity
tools.description: Perform multi-layered user identity verification, supporting various methods including SMS, email, biometrics, and hardware tokens.

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user, which can be a system internal ID, email address, or mobile number. This identifier is used to retrieve the user's authentication configuration and historical behavior patterns, with a maximum length of 128 characters.

verification_method.description: Method of identity verification. Supported options include: 'sms' (SMS code), 'email' (email code), 'biometric' (biometric verification), 'totp' (time-based one-time password), 'hardware_token' (hardware token), and 'password' (password verification). Methods can be combined to achieve multi-factor authentication.

verification_code.description: The verification code or credential which varies depending on the selected verification_method: SMS/email generates a 6-digit code, TOTP yields a 6-8 digit number, biometrics use encrypted feature data, and hardware tokens produce a dynamic code generated by the device.

success.description: Indicates whether the verification operation was successfully executed. A value of true means the verification process completed normally, while false indicates system errors or invalid parameters (not related to identity verification failure).

verified.description: Indicates whether the user's identity was successfully verified. A value of true signifies successful identity authentication, while false indicates authentication failure (e.g., incorrect code, mismatch in biometric traits).

confidence_score.description: Confidence score of the identity verification, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. It is computed based on factors such as the security level of the verification method, user behavior analysis, and device trustworthiness. A score above 0.8 indicates high confidence.

expires_at.description: Expiration time of the verification result, formatted in ISO 8601. Once expired, re-verification is required. Different verification methods have varying valid durations: SMS lasts 5 minutes, biometrics for 24 hours, and hardware tokens for 1 hour.

message.description: Detailed verification status and result message, including confirmation of success, reasons for failure, and safety recommendations. Examples include 'Identity verification successful, confidence 95%' or 'Verification code has expired, please request a new one.'

tools.name: create_user
tools.description: Creates a new user account with specified credentials.

username.description: The unique username for the new user account.

email.description: The email address associated with the new user account.

password.description: The password for the new user account, which must meet security requirements.

tools.name: delete_user
tools.description: Removes a specified user account from the system, ensuring complete data deletion.

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user account to be deleted.

tools.name: get_user
tools.description: Retrieve detailed user information based on the provided user ID.

id.description: The unique identifier associated with the user.

tools.name: update_user
tools.description: Modify the details of a user's profile using their unique identifier.

user_id.description: Unique identifier for the user whose profile is to be updated.

data.description: An object containing the fields to be updated in the user's profile.

tools.name: authenticate_user
tools.description: Validates user credentials for access to the system.

username.description: The unique identifier for the user, used for login purposes.

password.description: The secret key associated with the user account, required for authentication.

domains.description: Tools for comprehensive file system operations including creation, deletion, organization, and transfer of files

tools.name: create_file
tools.description: Creates a new file at the specified path with the given content.

path.description: The file system path where the new file will be created.

content.description: The content to be written into the newly created file.

tools.name: delete_file
tools.description: Removes a specified file from the filesystem.

file_path.description: The absolute or relative path to the file that needs to be deleted.

returns.success: Indicates whether the file deletion was successfully executed (true) or failed (false).

tools.name: list_files
tools.description: Retrieve a list of all files within a specified directory.

dir.description: The absolute or relative path to the directory whose files will be listed.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Moves a file from the source path to the specified target location.

source.description: The file path of the file to be moved.

target.description: The destination path where the file will be moved.

tools.name: upload_file
tools.description: Upload a file to the server at the specified URL.

file.description: The file object that needs to be uploaded.

url.description: The URL endpoint to which the file will be uploaded.

tools.name: download_file
tools.description: Downloads a file from a specified URL and saves it to a local path.

url.description: The URL of the file to be downloaded.

save_path.description: The local path where the downloaded file will be saved.

domains.description: Tools for comprehensive database operations including database creation, table management, and record manipulation (CRUD operations)

tools.name: create_database
tools.description: Create a new database with the specified name.

name.description: The unique name to assign to the new database.

tools.name: create_table
tools.description: Creates a new database table with a specified schema.

table_name.description: The name of the table to be created in the database.

schema.description: An object defining the structure of the table, including columns and their data types.

tools.name: drop_table
tools.description: Removes a specified table from the database permanently.

table.description: The name of the table to be dropped from the database.

tools.name: insert_record
tools.description: Inserts a new record into the specified database table.

table.description: The name of the database table where the record will be inserted.

data.description: An object containing the key-value pairs that represent the record's data to be inserted.

tools.name: update_record
tools.description: Updates an existing record in a specified database table.

table.description: The name of the database table where the record exists.

id.description: The unique identifier of the record to be updated.

data.description: An object containing the fields and their new values to update in the record.

tools.name: delete_record
tools.description: Removes a specific record from the specified database table.

table_name.description: The name of the database table from which the record will be deleted.

record_id.description: The unique identifier of the record to be deleted.

domains.description: Tools for automated web browsing, content extraction, and web page interaction

tools.name: browse_web
tools.description: Fetch and display content from a specified web page.

url.description: The web address (URL) of the page to be accessed.

tools.name: click_element
tools.description: Simulates a mouse click on a specified web element.

selector.description: A valid CSS selector to identify the web element to be clicked.

page_id.description: A unique identifier for the page containing the web element.

tools.name: get_page_content
tools.description: Extracts the textual content and metadata from a specified web page.

url.description: The complete URL of the web page from which content will be extracted.
